intro: Phyteuma inaequatum, commonly known as the unequal phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
